message_1: A transposition cipher involves rearranging the letters in a message to encrypt it. If a message has 50 letters and a transposition cipher is used to encrypt it by rearranging every 5th letter, how many letters will be in each of the resulting encrypted groups?
message_2: If a message has 50 letters and a transposition cipher is used to encrypt it by rearranging every 5th letter, there will be 10 groups of letters, each containing 5 letters.
